review: The buffalo wings here are gross. Wings were limp and moist under the sauce instead of crunchy like they're supposed to be.
Good food. The beer selection is okay with two IPAs. The service was on par but a shortage of staff can delay service during the lunch hours.

It's just a Friday's. Nothing extra-ordinary, but not bad.  Service wasn't the best i have had, decent food..  Good for lunch, if your looking for a night out, the bar isn't bad, especially if your visiting town. If your going out to dinner for the night, I'd choose another spot though, not worth a wait.
Sure at the bar! Great service no matter what server you have, they all help out. Never an empty drink and they're super nice! Food is good and it's hard to beat $3 beers on a fri or sat night!

Had lunch here on the way back from the airport.  Question: Does Jack Daniels own a part or own all of TGI Friday's? I swear to God, every thing on their menu is Jack Daniels this, Jack Daniels that.  So I order the Jack Daniels cheeseburger, which tasted nothing like Jack Daniels.(and believe me, I KNOW what Jack Daniels tastes like!) Even my date said this tastes nothing like Jack Daniels. Whatever. Bottom line: not so great and if you want some Jack Daniels.......go to the liquor store.

I live near the airport so I come to this TGI Friday's quite often back in the days.  I still go there with family from time to time to enjoy their drinks and decent meals (notice drinks first then meals).  They have lots of dishes to choose from but nothing really stands out with wow.  I like their drinks menu better and they do make them pretty good.  They have the signature Jack Daniels dishes which come with the sauce that suppose to have JD in it?  Not sure but it's sweet and tasty after you have couple of drinks.  If you like to eat late, like after 9pm, you have to go sit at the bar side then drinks and appetizers are half off.  They will charge you regular price if you sit at the regular dining area after 9pm so watch out for that tap!   It is next to the airport so lots of last minute tourists and business people eat there.  On Friday night it usually has some wait time to get seated.  Give them a try, mudslide drink is very good at least!

Chicken and Shrimp Pasta, Cheese burger, Pot Stickers.  Good service, the food was also good.   Same TGIF chain, but we were hungry and wanted some good food.  Their Chicken and Shrimp Pasta is a little spicy and hits the spot!

TGI Friday's has never been a premier choice for me as a foodie, but only I use this place to do business lunch meetings since I'm not gonna eat that much. This TGI in particular its just alright for me. The Service is alright, the food is just alright, so for me, I will only rate it 3 stars, nothing out of the ordinary all I have to say about this particular place at the MCO Area...
Ok.  Exactly what you expect.   Loud, semi-good food with semi-reliable service.    We had a late night beer and appetizers.  Nothing exceptional, but nothing bad either.
12 beers on tap.  Happy Hour 9 pm - close Half price appetizers.  Numerous beer and drink specials.

The parking lot at this location is a danger zone. This location is also remarkably packed during happy hour as it is very close to the airport and surrounded by hotels. The service was good considering how busy it was. Their two for $10 appetizer/entree is an excellent deal (4-7pm daily). The Jack Daniels burger is delicious.

I have found my "Home" TGI Friday's.  My complaint in the past was that some TGI Friday's were too loud.  This one by Orlando International Airport was rather quite pleasant.  I could actually have a conversation with my fellow diners.  Our waitress, Sierra was absolutly fabulous.  She was always there when we needed her.  Kept us informed as to the status of our meal.  She was magnificent.  Sierra informed us that this location is a, "corporate test site" so they will test several food and drink items from time to time.  Sierra also informed us that new food items coming soon.  "Give me more Stripes" and I'll keep coming to this location.
Good place for a Old Skool Virgin Atlantic reunions

This is one of the worst TGIFs I have ever been to. The pot stickers were extremely salty. The mojitos were not of the same quality as other TGIFs I have been to. The steak was 50% gristle. I am comparing to the last one that I frequented many times in Wichita, Kansas. And to top it off, they remove the favorite thing I enjoyed off of the menu. The Caribbean chicken sandwich. That had to be one of the best chicken sandwiches ever. I really don't see the need of ever returning to this particular restaurant. The only thing keeping this from being a one star review is that the service is actually very good and friendly.

I decided to drop my party off at the entrance on my fifth trip around the restaurant looking for parking.  At least they could get a jump on the wait time for a seat.  There is an outdoor seating area but it faces the parking lot and only had a handful of tables, I passed by it quite a few times looking for a place to park.  Finally, I parked in the neighboring hotel fearful that they would enforce parking for guests I half expected my car to have been towed.  After an additional 20 minute wait we were seated.  Our server was a nice guy and very attentive which was the saving grace.  I sampled the Jack Daniel's burger and my wife had a Jack Daniel's something or another, but I couldn't quite taste the resemblance.  I know Jack, probably better than I should, that isn't it.  I would have liked to enjoy more time with my friends I had not seen in years, but as it turns out roving bands of famished guests waiting for tables were lined up glaring at us in hopes that we would get up and leave, even if we hadn't finished out dinners.  Another large party was obviously not concerned that their kids were running full tilt around the restaurant which I found disturbing.  Ultimately, the food was mediocre and it just wasn't a comfortable experience.  Had it not been for our server, the experience would have rated a single star.  Fortunately, our car was still there at the end of our long walk.   Ultimately, I am inclined to go someplace else with guests from out of town.

I work in a "local" resraurant and we get a lot of service but.... I went to tgi to have a nice dinner with a friend, well they told us it would be a 5-10 min wait so we said okay if it took to long we'd go sit where the smokers smoke on the far right. well we waiting 30 minutes and still no buzz, so we went out side instead passed a waitress and sat down for another 20 minutes no drink or anything. the waitress we say was taking a 5 tops order... im a waitress it doesn't take 20 minutes to take orders.well that being said she came out and ask how we were doing and I said terrible weve been waiting for 30 mins to be seated and 20 for DRINKS (oh that by the way were watered down). and she said oh im sorry there anything I can do to make your night better and I said yes get out drinks and order in, she got our order rolled her eyes and went inside about 10 minutes went by and she brought our drinks. right after our app came out then we didn't get a refill on our drinks till we were half way finished with out meal, I believe in karma so im not gunna be cheap on a tip so I gave 20% but I will NOT be going back to this TGI.
Place rocks! My girl and I literaly love this place. Drink specials are awesome and have never had a problem

Went here Sunday night to have some beers before our flight. TVs everywhere. First thing that caught our attention was the bartender. He immediately introduced himself, shook our hands, and then asked what our names were. Then he said in case he wasn't available, his other bartender would help us, then he got her attention and had her stop in her tracks and introduced herself too. Then throughout the 3 hours of us sitting there, they both called us by name. He even pre ordered me another beer before happy hour ended, and I didn't even have to ask. The Yuengling was on point! We had a chicken appetizer and it was great. Defiantly a fun place. Miss those bartenders, they made the whole night!!

Food was fairly good. Typical Fridays fare. But the service was very poor, bordering on awful. Server failed to pay attention during ordering, and the food order came out incorrect as a result. Items that were requested on the side, never came out and we received a double order of an appetizer when only one was requested. The finishing touch was when the server tossed our servicing plates onto the table so they spun like a top. The multiple requests for initial drink order of sodas went unfulfilled until all the food was finished.

location: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA
review: Food was awful. DO NOT ATTEMPT. Coworker and myself were staying in hotel next door and thought it would be convenient to walk next door for take out. We were told we could order at bar so we did. After waiting 55 minutes and watching those around us and who came in after us eat we complained.  All I ordered was an appetizer and it took 55 minutes. Finally got food (rib, shrimp, chicken strips) and walked back to hotel and was very disappointed in the ribs. Tasted like they had been microwaved. Chicken tasted ok as does everything that is fried. I would definitely NOT recommend this restaurant or any other TGIF.

I came in with low expectations and expected an average experience at best. I was wow'd. Everything from food to drink to service to atmosphere was great. Food has improved and a good happy hour special even on a Friday. The 5 stars are for similar places in this category.

Only 3 stars this visit. I didn't like being seared by the server station & wanted a booth. We were then shown to a booth all the way in the back. More than a reasonable amount of time went by before Ginger came by. She almost seemed new or didn't feel comfortable.  Food was good as always, it just didn't seem like Friday this night.

This location stays open for dinner alot later than most others who stop serving at 11:00. TGI Friday's offers 1/2 price appetizers on Wednesday.  Be sure to join their rewards program where they offer points based on the amount spent..you also receive random coupons via email.The food is good, service is good and the atmosphere is great for socializing.  They also have awesome desserts.

TGI Fridays is one of my hubby's and I favorite casual spot. We have constantly had good food and service each time we have come which is great! They have changed up their menu and even the appearance giving it more of a classy look. Coming during happy hours are always good for cheaper apps and drinks. They have a taste and share menu, choose 3 apps for $15 or 5 for $22. They also have a pick 2 for $12 and a pick 2 for $16 where you can choose from their picked selection of apps and entrees. Personally I LOVE anything Jack Daniels here, especially the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich. I usually get a side salad but always steal a couple french fries from my husband as they are amazing! They have an amazing Sedona black bean burger that has this chipotle mayo, melted Monterey Jack and cheddar, balsamic glazed onions and sliced avocado. They have plenty of yummy desserts to choose from, ranging from their Tennessee whiskey cake to the brownie obsession and the Oreo madness (our personal favorites). Join their give me more stripes program to get points for free appetizers, desserts, and entrees. They have an auction with their "xtra" points online which allows you to purchase or try and win different gift cards and merchandise.
Very friendly service...food is ok...I like the appetizer platter...
Very reasonable prices with good service. Had my food chard a bit and told the waitress.  I was given a new portion and ice-cream for the kids. Thumbs up

The $10 all you can eat appetizers were amazing but not as amazing as our server Christine.   We ordered buffalo boneless wings, tomato garlic bruschetta, pot stickers, and potato skins. We made it through 3 trays before we quit.  We also ordered the berry mojito shakers which were FABULOUS! It's always Friday in here!!!

Went here last night for dinner with my fiance. It was the first time we have gone to a TGIF. The food was really good. I got the Jack Daniels Burger and we got mozerella sticks as an appetizer. I liked them both a lot. My fiance got the turkey burger and he liked that a lot as well. The things that we didn't like was that all the staff looked miserable. Every single staff member looked like they hated to be there and it took a lot out of the experience. Also, our waitress was very inattentive. I didn't get a single refill the whole time we were there. The other thing that I didn't like was that there weren't much people there when we got there, but we were sat next to a table with a screaming baby. The baby was screaming the whole time of my meal, including right after we were seated with many other available tables. So, in all, food was great but in all, I wouldn't necessarily go back.

We did stay in the Sheraton Airport which is a few minutes by feed away. The Dinner was fine, my wife had a Cesar Chicken Salad and my boys and me had a fine steak. The Rump Steak was a bit to rare for my son even we ordered medium. I had the Sirloin and liked it.
Great service at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and always addressed you by your name.  The food was also good.

If you want a quick bite to eat or a pretty decent happy hour...FRIDAYS never fails....its my go to place. However, I did discover the cotton candy martini...YUMMMM....$3 martinis on Wednesdays.....and half off appetizers....thursdays is $3 thursdays...which includes different drinks which are $3 and apps....like I said....its my go to place.

Nice location for hanging out.  The bar area is pretty nice feeling for hanging out  Food is exceptional. Could def be better but the portions size on foods are bad.  Besides prices going up. On the menu. The size of portions are getting smaller.    Use to be great on food before but not as much.   Good drink specials on certain days

Thai pulled pork sliders from TGI Friday's down by Orlando Airport. They are super small but they're supposed to be for $5. They have a lot of nice ginger flavors and good textures from the meat and slaw. For such small bites they're a pretty satisfying snack, as an appetizer should be! :) Friday's is still one of my favorite corporate chains but they are closing down stores every time I look. Closest one in Altamonte Springs is gone now frown emoticon I'm a still a stripes member because their rewards are actually decent. I've used them to get a few free meals for Sada and me. I like the free chips too.

I love Friday's when I am craving a long island and fried green beans. We love the service at the Carrier Rd location but it is pretty far from us and they don' t have outdoor seating like this location does which we love. It is Florida after all :)  Our first experience was a bad one at this location with a waiter who actually told us that Friday's didn't have fried greens beans anymore and they didn't have any drink specials ... we didn't feel like arguing so we just ordered other things  .... I suspect he was just being lazy or trying to get a bigger tip for higher priced items ... didn't work ... we had to keep asking other people who worked there to send him back to refill our drinks, etc.  However, we decided to give it another chance and the past few times we have been there we have had great service. This is our new to go spot.

I must say that TGI Fridays has certainly gotten better since the last time I visited one many years ago. I had thier Strawberry Mule made with Titos vodka. The server warned me that it had a ginger kick but that is what a mule is supposed to have right? The strawberry balanced it out nicely and it wasn't super sweet either. We also had the wedge salad, which was very nice, crisp and cold, and the Jack Daniel's ribs. Soooo good!! Everything was nice hot and fresh and considering it was after 11pm that is saying something!! The whole bar was full and most of the restaurant which made service a little slow but our server had a great attitude.

This place really sucks hard.  The server was nice, but honestly we could tell it was a "fake" nice.  We were there when it was pretty empty and the service was slow as molasses.  I had a flight to catch so that didn't help much. There was a weird cleaner smell that wasn't pleasant.  I was beginning to regret suggesting this place, but stayed due to time constraints. I asked for the gluten free menu and it was abysmal.  First of all it pretty much says "We don't  REALLY offer Gluten Free items because we refuse to set an area aside for you"  Fine...  I had a flight to catch and no time to really go anywhere else.  I can handle A TINY BIT of cross-contamination.  This is a national chain, so you would have thought they would at least try.  The menu (gluten free)  had a few items but all were fleshcentric and items that really are just naturally made without flour or gluten.  But, you have to LOVE meat or you are screwed.  Which meant I was pretty much screwed.  So I get the tomato soup and a salad (so exciting) and halfway through my soup I find a french fry in it.  That in itself is well...gross since you don't know exactly where that fry came from.  A half-eaten plate being handled above my food?  A lazy cook who just flings stuff all over? This really didn't bode well for my "gluten free" choices. Either way, I got very sick from this food.  I had a flight to JFK and then one to London.  Yay.   I give this dismal chain the flying bird salute.  I never loved it when I ate meat and didn't know I had an autoimmune disease, and hate it now.

We ate here twice on our recent vacation, mainly because the service and food were great the first time. The second server was even better than the first and really interacted with the kids. Great experiences!

Host was super cute!!! Blueberry Pom Long Island iced teas were weak.  Ordered apps...... Sliders were great, but you only get two.  Got Sriracha Buffalo wings, NOT SPICEY..... Try the Ghost wings!  Service was great!

I don't know what happened to Friday's Potato Skins but they definitely have changed and not for they better.  I dined at the bar which has three bartenders who couldn't care  less if you needed anything.  The one woman, Liz I believe, was the better of the three, but even she left to go to  Walmart because her boyfriend wouldn't go.  (While my glass sat empty) This Friday's is located right at the airport and surrounded by hotels so I guess the clientele changes every day and customer service is not a priority. If you're stuck in town, try Chillis down the street, I am

Came for lunch with 2 others and everything was on par.  2 of us had the Choose 3 Appetizers and they were spot on. I've had this option at other locations, and wasn't as impressed as I was with this location. The service was attentive and the orders were correct.
Ask for James to be your waiter.  He is the best. Fast Friendly Courteous and thoughtful. Our food was well prepared and came quickly.

I was very interested in TGI Friday， and last weekend we tried but it was not a good experience. the table for two people is really small.we ordered Chicken wings and it was really salty......the watermelon cooler drink is alright、but the watermelon cube was not fresh. And here comes the worst part：the TOP SIRLOIN is A DISASTER！ I swear to God I could make much better beef than theirs！ I said I wanted it medium rare，however it was very thick，dry and chewy...... NOT recommend and will not come back.

TGI Fridays has gone down in my opinion.  The menu has lost any  simplicity and every  dish must have goop on it. I ordered a small steak served on spinach and as the food arrived a large person appeared at my back and poured sticky glob on it.  I tasted it and it was sweetly alcoholic. After I made known my displeasure it was replaced with an unadorned hamburger with pedestrian french fries. The burger was o.k. only. Save your money.

Fridays has some good promotions. But every time I find a meal or food that I like, they change their menu. They invented the potato skins but last year, they changed it to be less skin and more white filling. It tastes awful now. The texture is mushy instead of crispy and cheesy. Even the mozzarella sticks changed into a less appetizing appetizer.
Our order came out wrong BUT our server (Alyce) and the manager handled it perfectly and even offered a free dessert!  Ideal customer service!

Have to give credit where credit is due.  I'm not a fan of chain restaurants and haven't been to a TGI Friday's in years but travel, ya know'.   Found the food and service to be good at this location.  I ordered the Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta and it was very well executed.  The pasta was cooked perfectly, the sauce was light and well spiced.  Very pleased with my meal at this location.  My compliments to the cook. As an aside.  Since I haven't been to this chain in years I was a bit surprised by the prices.  Entrees were about $15.00.  No big deal, I just always think of this type of restaurant to be very inexpensive.  Whatever....Guess they have some good bar/happy hour specials but I'm not much into the bar food. I will be back.

I'm sorry to say this: I've come here a HAND FULL of times, always had a great experience with the staff, especially Melissa... Butttttt I'm reviewing about this nights experience only... We had a new server named Kirby (bar side)- who was not pleasant. I'm sorry, but he needs to pull that stick out his **tt. We felt really uncomfortable with his service today. I'm not sure if he was having a bad day, sorry if you were Kirby, or maybe he's That Guy.......? I'm not at all a hard person to deal with.. I myself have worked restaurant.. I have respect for the staff, but when I have a simple inquiry (which I'm sure was not the first time) you do not need to talk to me like I'm in grade school.. Not cool. Not only that, also, when I give you a promotion card (that I received from YOUR RESTAURANT) don't just take it, return it without saying anything, walk away, and not use it.... Hellllloooo ???? What's up?? I've received many of them and used it many of times. I just wish for management to straighten him out. I am a regular...... Was....? I just hope if the next time I do return, I don't have him as my server.

Service is taking forever with the food and its not even that packed. They bring u food and leave the dishes on the table just piling up. Worst of all if ur thirsty you better bring your own water cuz your gonna be thirsty

Bad experience - we were informed that the computers were down and the food might take longer, which it did.  After waiting quite awhile our appetizer showed at our table.  Only problem was that we did not have plates, silverware or water.  We asked three different people for those items before they finally arrived, meanwhile the appetizer had gotten cold.  To add insult to injury, our server argued with us that that she couldn't bring us those items in the 30 minutes we were waiting because the computers were down.  I can tell you as a former waitperson, you don't need a computer to bring out plates, silverware and water.  This place is poorly run and I will not be returning.
Great place for indoor and outdoor eating. Great drink specials and unlimited appetizers for $12 can't beat that. Friendly servers

I personally don't do the chain restaurant thing much, but it's usually just because I'm a vegan and barely have any options. This time I went out for a few drinks and apps w my friends and let me tell you. My entire 6 person party was highly disappointed. Upon arrival we were asked how many in our party. We continue to inform them that's it's a party of 6 and we'd really prefer to sit outside. The hostess walks outside and simply nods her head no. She keeps walking thru the diner and we follow to see if she's gonna take us outside thru another door or something. She then stops and we kinda just stood around in confusion. We asked if we were gonna sit inside or something and she said that was our table in a somewhat rude way in return to our confusion. We got sat next to the bathrooms which we tried to switch, but saw no employee around to do so. We just stood up and switched tables to the next big  open table away from the bathrooms but still in the bar area. It honestly took 15 minutes just to get greeted. We put in our drink order and it took another 15-20 minutes to get our drinks. The appetizers arrived about 10 minutes after ordering which is cool, but aren't the drinks supposed to get there first?  We were done w apps and ready for more apps before the drinks were even being made. Basically due to the slow service we only had time for 3 drinks and two apps in a 2.5 hr span. I would return there because of the drink specials, but only if it had better service. Oh and the thing to it all is that it was fully staffed from what it looked like and barely any customers inside so what was taking so long? Either way I give ale house props for always taking care of everything properly when we do the chain restaurant drinking thing.

Well, I don't usually go to chains and I certainly don't Yelp about it when I do, but since we're passing through Orlando and this was on the way to the airport, we couldn't help ourselves. It's what you'd expect - there's something oddly satisfying about that deep-fried aroma and watered down Coke. And say what you will about chains, the mozzarella sticks here are amazingly good. Downgraded slightly due to a server charging us for a side we didn't order, but he did correct the mistake.

If you want a place where employees talk behind your back and make fun of you this would be awesome...horrible experience my wife and I are a little chubby and we overheard a cook calling us shamu/shamu, never again!!!

In my lunch break I went with a group of co-workers to eat lunch.  We had a horrible experience.  We were waiting for 15 minutes to get the drinks, around 45 minutes for the lunch and the food was cold.  The whole process was about 2 hours from the beginning to the end. The restaurant was not crowded, it was clean in and outside.  I do not recommend this location.  This is the second time that I visit this location, and I had similar experience, bad service, and poor quality of food.

My son selected this restaurant from the many in the area and I kind of wish he hadn't. It was about one o'clock on a Friday (today) and our service was so slow. The restaurant wasn't even full at the time.  My tea was completely empty by the time I got a refill. We waited 10 minutes for the waitress to bring us extra napkins. But the true topper was when the lady (not the waitress) brought out our food. I asked her why my salad didn't have the extra tomatoes I ordered and she said,"I don't know but I will get you some." Five minutes go by and she brought me the tomatoes. I thanked her then my son said "hey, do you guys have honey mustard sauce?" She looked a bit exasperated, sighed and said, "Yeah we do. Now do you need anything ELSE before I go back there?" We said no and she walked away. My son and I looked at each other and said, "Wow! Really? Isn't that her job? It's not like I did it on purpose!" Between that and the exceptionally slow service, I was a bit disappointed. We usually have great service and enjoy the food immensely. I don't know when I'll be back now...

Arriving late night from Las Vegas, my wife and I had few options for a late night dinner and drinks. Thankfully TGIF was open. We were greeted by Renea, our server, and the evening became a very memorable experience. Renea waited on us promptly and made sure that we did not miss the last call for food and drinks. Thank you Renea for making our first day in Orlando a day to remember!

Usually a pretty positive diner. Don't go. I went for a Cobb salad. Bar and table side half full.  1 hour and 20 minutes later, had to remind the waiter I'd ordered at all. Stuff happens in the restaurant biz but got the sense that mediocrity is par for the course at this one.

This location is crazy busy of course being on IDrive.  Went there a couple weeks ago and sat at the bar.  Bartender was nice, not pushy but always kept an eye on my beverages.  For the rest typical Friday's crowd and food

This place looks great inside, the service in the front can use some work, as I entered to where the host should be greeting customer she was not there waited for about 20 min on a bench until someone noticed me and food was not cooked the way asked for( medium) they gave me a well done, the sweet potatoes fries were over seasoned with salt! I had to use a napkin to remove some of the excessive salt. Overall waited about 45 mins for my meal to be prepared and they still got the order wrong smh.

This location in particular has horrible service in the evening. We sit in the bar area to get the drink specials and more often than not we end up walking out. We'll be seated and wait a good ten minutes before we finally give up and head out.

Service was very bad and customer service. We pretty much didn't have a waitress at all. Then we paid bill through app, and we left. She was quickly to walk out and stop us and ask us did we pay. We looking like really. So she assume we didn't pay, as she is a employee and should know about this feature. We were very offended. Never come to this place again.

Surprised service wasn't better. Order and wrong items sent out and no ownership.  REALLY my tip was adjusted to reflect the poor service.  I would never go to this TGI Friday's again.  Poor performance.  Portions sizes seem really small in comparison to other across country.  Bottom of the chain restaurants

Our party was split on rating our dining experience this evening at this particular location. Half of us enjoyed the food and the other half didn't enjoy it at all and felt it was not worth the calories.  I enjoy TGI Friday's in other cities and enjoy my meal most often, but I was not impressed at all in Orlando. Burgers: buns were dry and meat overcooked. Fries were edible but not very fresh. Would not order again. Baby back ribs: pretty good but ribs were very small. Would order again but maybe a full slab. Mahi Mahi: really good, fresh and moist. Spinach side dish and jasmine rice pilaf were great. would order again. Sizzlin Chicken w shrimp: chicken was overcooked. Shrimp was kinda weird covered in tomato sauce. Mashed potatoes were ok. and really this wasn't the dish we initially ordered but we took it to avoid waiting again for the other dish to be prepared. Would not order again. I will say that customer service was great and staff was friendly during our visit. We were welcomed warmly, seated quickly and our server was very attentive and engaging.

Always enjoying late night dining.   After 10 pm the spots are $5.00 and they have great drink specials.   Been know to go there just for the apps and drinks.   Also have a great deal on a full rack of Jack Daniel's  ribs for $10.00 and they truly fall of the bone.
Bartenders are great. Drinks are cheap. I love this place I'm here work work several times a month.
I mean it's a chain restaurant... So when they forget to bring out silverware and don't check on you for 26 minutes it's ok right?

My Kids and I from Mass, I recommend  this restaurant  the Waitress  Super Great Specially  Miguel he has Great manners, and a Smile, the best  thing I Love is when the Waiter  bring Napkins  with out asking..My Kids Felts Special, That a Beautiful  things to see. I LOVE IT!!!! Thanks Miguel!!! U Rock!

Honestly I am not a fan of chain restaurants but on this specific visit, I was pleasantly surprised with the food and the service. My 6 year old son was craving steak at 11am so we headed to Friday's and we were the first customers thru the door. Our server Alyssa was exceptional! She had a smile every time she came to the table and the service overall was 5 stars! My son had the Jack Daniel's Ribeye and I chose to have the Jack Daniel's Half Rack. Both entrees came out in less than 15 minutes and we were both pleased with the flavors. I tried the steak and it was tender and seasoned well. My ribs were ok, they were small and the meat was not as tender as I would've hoped but you get what you pay for. This TGIF is located at the corner of Semoran and N Frontage Road near the Orlando International Airport.

Me and my friends have been staying at Hyatt Place Orlando Airport while waiting for us to close on our house. We have gone to Friday's literally every day for a week now. We noticed that Friday's fixes their reward program to where you cannot get points quick enough. What that means is you have to wait a week to post more than 2 receipts. No other restaurant does this. When I asked Raseesh if I need to take my business elsewhere he replied with "come in tonight and we will comp an entree". First the bartender told me and my friends the manager said he couldn't find the note from the previous manager and they can't comp endless apps. Friday's is obviously hurting. Do you know of a Friday's with good service? They can't keep one owner and the Internet is filled with more complaints than positives. But I digress. I ask for the manager, the GM, who obviously is frustrated with his job and has anger management issues. Because after I asked why the bartender said there was no note, he said "he didn't say that to you". First of all, you don't argue with a guest and you don't speak in a hostile tone with anyone. Let alone a customer. After we pointed out that we all heard the same thing, he says "we don't comp endless apps". So I will be taking my business elsewhere from now on.  No wonder this location has bad service. If the GM thinks it's ok to talk to a guest especially one that spends like I do there, imagine what he tolerates there.
Endless Apps were delicious and our server Nicole was the best if you have a taste for great food an great service this Fridays location is the place to go.

It's a chain, so keep that in mind. A whole lot of items on the menu, but the place suffers from a bit of menu dejavu --- like you see "Jack Daniels chicken" in what seems like 11 different places on the menu. Almost as if someone decided that they would have three meat options, and then came up with 20 ways to serve each of those. Bar had local stuff, which is good - but not an overabundance.

Fridays! This place is pretty cool, the one in New York is better cause every Friday they have a DJ but I mean not my number one spot to go to but nice to have close to home. The happy hour here as to drinks are good and the apps are great, the fact they have the $10 all you can eat apps is great and they have a new bucket apps. Since I've been here the service is good but I'll tell you one thing, this place is good to come and eat but when it comes to online or over the phone ordering it is horrible. The times I've put a online or phone order they have always messed up my order, either they forget an order or just got the order wrong. So I will never again put another online or phone order I rather go there and eat. I have to say the mozzarella sticks and pot stickers are really good also they have these new chicken tacos which are very good and an entrée the best thing I've had here so far is the sizzling chicken and cheese with mashed potatoes those are amazing!

Fabulous place to get quality service from knowledgeable, friendly and efficient staff. The server provided us plenty of time to make our selection for drinks followed by time foe us to decide if lunch

Great food, excellent people, nice place.  Great for dates and family meals.  I find the steaks, ribs and shrimp are always on point.  I have eaten at this location several times.  As with all the other Fridays the experience is on par with the standards of the restaurant brand.
Endless Apps?  They take 20 minutes between each order.  3 Appetizers an hour doesn't make any sense.

Visited last night with a date, decided to sit outside there was a young lady with a non-service dog which sat in the walk way and she did not want to move the dog from the walk way. Then once we got to our seats after ordering the endless apps, it was 20 minutes before the first apps came out and the flatbread was cold and rock solid crust. I then ordered the meatballs after another 20 minutes the meatballs came out cold and the bread was rock hard. Best thing about the experience was the server he was great, sorry cant remember his name due to the other problems but he was very apologetic.
We stopped bye for lunch during our stay.  Our waiter Shawn was great.  Totally would come back for the 10 dollar all you can eat appetizers.

Came for endless apps disappointed that You can only order one at a time then have to wait 20 mins for another one at rush hour it'll take you an hour to eat a full meal this policy needs to be adjusted like let people order 3 at a time (sorta like the pick 3 that use to be on the menu) unfair to other diners in the same party to eat a meal and have to wait that long!!?

I read the reviews and was kind of skeptical. But,came touust get the appetizers and drinks. Ryan was great. Brought our drinks gave  time to decide. Ordered the after hour appetizers they came rather quickly. Everything was got and ready! He kept checking on the table. Brought drinks in a timely manner. I would come back. Ryan And the food expediter was awesome!!!! Way to go.

I'm from New York & am a regular at Fridays.  While on vacation here in Orlando i stopped in at this particular location and was highly disappointed. 1st, when we walked in the 'hostess" didn't even acknowledge us, instead she stood there with two co-workers chit chatting. When we finally get seated, our server, Ryan, constantly forgot what we ordered. My son sat there crying, and his food never came. I was highly upset with the neglect, so I asked for a box so I could take my food to go. I know Friday's is better then this. Maybe just not this Friday's. The whole night was a disaster and to top it off, when I got home I realized my steak wasn't cooked how I requested.
Waited for 25 minutes, told the hostess and still no one came over. Manager didn't seem to care when I handed him my menu and walked out.

I've visited this location on many occasions and have had nothing but positive experiences. Today was no different except for my decision to choose the turkey burger. In one word it was awful! But the boba long island iced tea more than made up for it.

Standard menu, a little overpriced but they know their market. The food was fine, nothing extraordinary. Service was a little on the slow side, but it was a fairly busy night and the kitchen had its challenges. I don't blame the server. My only real complaint is the music was blaring so loudly that we had to shout to be heard across the table. If I want to listen to loud music, I'll go home and listen to music I like. The restaurant is close to the airport and it's a good place to wait for a visitor's flight to arrive. I wouldn't recommend it for any other purpose.
What a dump!  Slow service, food mediocre, noise level high and lousy drinks!   3 strikes and their out!!!

I am a local and I live near the airport. We went to TGI Friday's to celebrate my nieces 19th birthday. The service was terrible and the food was terrible also. I felt like we were putting the server out. They definitely have lost my business.

This was my 1st time going to Fridays. I was really impressed with the interior of the restaurant. I went here during the back end of my vacation at Disney World. I stopped here right before me and my family flew back to New York. The service here was very good. The place is clean and the food was made good. I would definitely stop back here if I'm in the Orlando area. I highly recommend coming here.
Thank you Johnny for your great service and positive spirit!! You made this visit enjoyable for me and my dad.

This is based on an  actual customer  experience with bartender Zach.  He is a genuinely friendly informative guy who made for a pleasant happy hour experience.  Friday's is lucky to have him there. The poo poo platter sort of app was good enough ( chicken fingers, cheese sticks ).

Hands down the worse staff. I placed an online order with what I wanted. The food was old and cold. Called the location the bar tender answered the phone I told him what was wrong and I guess he thought he muted the phone and called me a bad word. My my I couldn't get over there fast enough. Then the young lady went and got the manager some goofy young lady that thought it was a joke.  Want to come apologize to me with some generic apology.  It's customer service your job is to treat your customers well.  I didn't make the food so why are you mad at me? If you don't like your job quit

I enjoy going to Friday's but NOT coming to this one again! First time we came here we had issues with the meal and wait time but we decided to give it a second chance.  We ordered drinks and appetizers.  Appetizers came no drinks. We waited and waited our server didn't show. So we asked another server and Wallah! drinks came and our food - but the drinks arrived watered down..  and a meal was missing ONE item.  so waiter snatched the entire plate and hurried away.   the waiting began again. Server kept blowing past us, and we waited.  It finally came back a different meal... arrrgh!   We sent it back, requested mgmt and we complained. Drinks were refused and Mgmt was going to fix the meal issue.  We waited and waited and waited. finally they did it right this time.  By then hunger had been replaced with frustration and we just paid for what was eaten and BUT WAIT!!,  we had to wait and wait and wait for our card and receipt!!!... The table next to us and a table further down also asked for mgmt.. second chance fail for this restaurant .. Not coming here again.  Not this Friday's... nope.

Typical Fridays.  It is what it is.  Good , fast service.  The new Brussels Sprouts were great. Also 'New' to their Menu is Fish and Chips.  Fish was nice and crunchy, Fries remind d me of Burger King - but the main this is they have no Malt Vinegar.  How do you do Fish and Chips without it.

Food was good and the wait for our food was minimal which was great seeing as though we had just arrived off a 2 and 1/2 hour flight and were starving! We had a large party (9 adults and 3 kids with 2 in high chairs) and was a little disappointed that they didn't have the space to put us all together at 1 table so we were at 2 separate tables.  The bummer of the night was that my friends mom left her card after paying and we called the restaurant back (about 20mins after leaving) to check and see if anyone turned it in and was left on hold for what seemed like forever, so we just drove back over. When we let the host and another server know why we were back, they seemed a little confused on what to do.  The host even asked for my friends moms drivers license like she was going to compare her name to the card they'd found, but when we asked if they had found it she says they hadn't. Sooo why would you ask for her license?! Very confusing. Anyways our server was kind enough to move the tables and chairs to see if it had fallen and even checked all of the black bill fold books - nothing. Other than that everything was cool.

We don't have one of these in KC anymore but oh how I loved Friday's. They have get drink prices , a great reward system, and friendly staff. Our waiter joked and laughed with us, brought sharing spoons for the dessert, put apple juice in my daughters soppy, etc. he was attentive but not overbearing, great balance.  I downloaded the app and I had quite a few points so I decided to get a free dessert along with my drinks.  It was convenient to my hotel. So we just walked over although it hit us that there are gators in Florida so we got a ride back lol.  We went back the next night too!

I just tried the Beyond Meat burger patty. I ordered the Jack Daniels burger the sauce is Vegan and there is no cheese I replaced the meat with a vegan option Beyond Meat patties (x2) this is by far the most amazing burger on the planet. TGI Friday has a new hit on their hands. Guilt free vegan burger that tastes better than the real thing.
